explanations.machine learning: The paper explicitly mentions the use of machine learning techniques to predict hospital readmissions.
explanations.supervised learning: The study develops predictive models (GBC, LR, SGD) which are supervised learning methods.
explanations.classification: The models (GBC, LR, SGD) are used for classifying patients into high-risk or low-risk categories for readmission.
explanations.gradient-boosting classifier: One of the predictive models developed in the study is a gradient-boosting classifier (GBC).
explanations.logistic regression: One of the predictive models developed in the study is logistic regression (LR).
explanations.stochastic gradient descent: One of the predictive models developed in the study uses stochastic gradient descent (SGD).
explanations.feature learning: The study mentions automatic extraction of features from patient data, which is related to feature learning.
explanations.feature representation: The study involves evaluating demographic, clinical, and outcome characteristics, which relates to feature representation.
